database.note: SINGLE DATABASE ONLY - Assert this path in every connection

key_directories.tools: tools/src/ - Main library code (metrics, outliers, plan, suppress)
key_directories.analysis: analysis/ - ALL analysis outputs, temp files, reports

cube_tables.level: Aggregated at date, state, dma_name, winner, loser

census_cube_tables.level: Aggregated at date, state, dma_name, winner, loser, census_block_id

rolling_views.note: DOW-aware rolling metrics with TIERED windows (28d preferred, fall back to 14d, then 4d)

tiered_logic.weekend: Requires 2+ periods minimum (more lenient due to fewer samples)
tiered_logic.selected_window: Column shows which tier was used (28, 14, 4, or NULL)

enriched_views.purpose: Combines pair-level + national-level metrics for UI
enriched_views.note: Created on-demand for main.py, filtered to graph window

hierarchical_levels: census_block (cb_id, dma, winner, loser) - Surgical precision

zscore.note: DOW-partitioned rolling windows with TIERED fallback (28d→14d→4d)

first_appearance.level: DMA (winner, loser, dma) - not census block
first_appearance.note: New blocks appear daily, DMA level more stable

minimum_volume.note: Ignore pairs with < 5 wins on target date

tiered_thresholds.preferred: 28 preceding days (needs 4+ DOW periods for weekday, 2+ for weekend)
tiered_thresholds.fallback_1: 14 preceding days (needs 4+ DOW periods for weekday, 2+ for weekend)
tiered_thresholds.fallback_2: 4 preceding days (needs 4+ DOW periods for weekday, 2+ for weekend)
tiered_thresholds.note: DOW partitioning prevents false positives from weekend spikes
tiered_thresholds.implementation: Tiered logic in scan_base_outliers() - selects best available window

windows.weekday: 28d, 14d, or 4d based on availability (minimum 4 DOW periods)
windows.weekend: 28d, 14d, or 4d based on availability (minimum 2 DOW periods - more lenient)
windows.architectural_insight: Calculate rolling metrics over ENTIRE time series, then filter to graph window at the end

main_py_steps: 0. Preview base graph - Unsuppressed national shares
2. Build plan - Generate auto + distributed suppression
3. Save plan - Store to database and CSV

stage_2_distributed.caps: Respects pair capacity (can't remove more than exists)
stage_2_distributed.goal: No single DMA bears full burden

top_50_filter.scope: Total wins over entire time series
top_50_filter.note: Focus on top 50, but flag outliers with 40+ impact outside

tools.db.get_db_path(): Returns canonical DB path with assertion

main_py_restoration.approach: Phase-by-phase with validation at each step
main_py_restoration.phase_2_status: ✅ All helper functions working, NaN fixes applied, main.py running on port 8502

decisions_made.round_conflicts: Error with overwrite option + alert box
decisions_made.max_suppression_cap: NO CAP - remove full excess (user requirement)
decisions_made.rare_pairs: Only if z-score violation AND impact > 15
decisions_made.legacy_mode: Keep toggle for old rare pair detection

common_mistakes.csv_only: Save to BOTH database AND CSV for compatibility
common_mistakes.nan_to_integer: ALWAYS check for NULL AND NaN before CAST(...AS INTEGER) - use: WHEN col IS NOT NULL AND NOT isnan(col) THEN CAST(...)
common_mistakes.rolling_metrics_null: Early dates have NULL rolling metrics - TIERED approach reduces this (28d→14d→4d)
common_mistakes.tiered_window_handling: Use selected_window column to see which tier was used; filter WHERE selected_window IS NOT NULL to exclude early dates
common_mistakes.rolling_view_columns: Rolling views use: avg_wins, stddev_wins, n_periods, selected_window (NOT avg_wins_28d, n_periods_28d)
common_mistakes.scan_base_outliers_implementation: ✅ CORRECT: Calculates rolling metrics over ENTIRE time series, filters to graph window at end (line 295). Always check WHERE clause is at final SELECT.
common_mistakes.nan_handling: ✅ FIXED: All CAST operations now check: WHEN col IS NOT NULL AND NOT isnan(col) THEN CAST(...) ELSE 0/NULL

git_workflow.validation: Get user approval before proceeding to next phase
git_workflow.testing: Test each change immediately after implementation

analysis_workflow.cleanup: Remove temp files, keep final reports in docs/
